meanings.definition: To remove blindness or restore sight.
meanings.sent1: The doctor helped unblind the patient after successful surgery.
meanings.sent2: The miracle surgery was able to unblind the person who had been blind for years.
meanings.sent3: After the operation, the patient joked that the doctor had a magic wand to unblind people.
meanings.sent4: The sunrise seemed to unblind the world, revealing its true colors.
meanings.sent5: The potion had the power to unblind anyone who drank it, bringing back their lost vision.

meanings.sent1: The documentary aimed to unblind the public about the effects of climate change.
meanings.sent2: The shocking news report unblinded everyone to the dangers of the situation.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's creative lesson plan was designed to unblind the students to the wonders of science.
meanings.sent4: The wise words of the elder unblinded the young man to the harsh realities of life.
meanings.sent5: The vivid images in the art exhibition unblinded visitors to the artist's unique perspective.
